cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the central Texas coast (near Port O’Connor/Matagorda Bay) with a tendency to slow and drift north-northwest, then meander over southeast Texas through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor – Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX (includes Galveston Bay/Houston area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and parts of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are possible at the port beginning early Friday with a peak probability of 39%; chance of sustained 50-kt (≈58 mph) winds is 8%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft possible along the Upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of rain with isolated totals near 20 inches possible through Tuesday, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding around the port and its hinterland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged flooding of access roads, possible temporary port closure, dangerous surf and rip currents on the Houston/Galveston approaches.
